decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The proposed two storey side extension, single storey rear extension, a rear roof extension, and roof lights to the front, would by virtue of their size position and appearance appear as an overdevelopment of the site, unduly dominant and harmful to the character and appearance of the area, contrary to UDP Policies ENV-B.1.1 and H. 6.4 and the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 'Residential Extensions Guidelines'.


The proposed two storey side extension and single storey rear extension would by virtue of their size and position result in harm to the living conditions of the adjoining property through loss of light and outlook, contrary to UDP Policies ENV-B.1.1 and H. 6.4 and the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 'Residential Extensions Guidelines'.
.

The proposed windows to the rear of the two storey side extension and within the roof extension would overlook the adjoining properties leading to loss of privacy and giving rise to harm their living conditions, contrary to UDP Policies ENV-B.1.1 and H. 6.4 and the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Guidance 'Residential Extensions Guidelines'.
description: Erection of a two storey side extension, single storey rear extension and erection of a rear roof extension incorporating 3 roof windows to front elevation to dwellinghouse.
